root: ^The Consul greets you with a courteous nod. "You made it back. Which means you've already proven yourself more capable than most of the rabble that answers the Gilded Summons."
^checkpoint:3;Skip: I'm ready for the next assignment

vesparin: ^An assassination plot against the Count? I was hoping we could avoid the nuisance of noble bickering and political drama. Unfortunately, it seems like even a holy war can't put an end to their petty squabbles.

c-4: ^It's a minor miracle you were able to save our missing merchant amidst all that chaos. I have my doubts about the organisation he represents, but their supplies are essential to the Radiant Crusade."
c-5: ^A shame you weren't able to find the merchant, we could have used the supplies but I have more pressing matters at this time."

druids: ^"A secret cult of Selandris hoping to bring back their long-dead god? It looks like we might have underestimated how our efforts would be recieved by the locals..."
crimson: ^"Traitors? Led by one of my former sergeants, no less. Disgusting. I can stomach those wary of our cause, but to abandon it altogether and surrender to the corruption- it's revolting."
reward: ^The consul reaches into a drawer on her oaken desk and hands you a heavy pouch. "On behalf of the Radiant Militia I thank you, [[class]]. You've taken care of quite the problem."
war: ^"Ah yes." the consul pauses for a moment and takes a seat behind her desk, pressing the tips of her fingers against each other as she proceeds."
^"As you might have gathered by now, our war effort against the Black Citadel isn't  going exactly... as planned."
^"The demons' resistance has been far stronger than we anticipated. Their numbers seem to grow by the hour while ours dwindle every day."

c-9: ^"We call him the Dawnbringer now, but he was once known by his given name, Corellion Solspear. A Candorian Noble, discovered to be the Champion by the Order of the Gilded Rose itself."
c-10: ^"The Dawnbringer is not just a warrior of the Light, he is also our banner. A rallying cry to the men and women of the Radiant Militia. To give them the courage they need to push into the hordes that await us in Umbris."
c-11: ^The Consul looks up and seems to think for a moment, before taking a deep breath.
^"Our Champion is... missing. I tell you this because you've earned the truth. Every day the men and women of the militia grow more anxious as our numbers dwindle."
^"Without our Champion, the troops will lose morale. And if we can't change the tide, Brightcandle will be overwhelmed within weeks, if not days."

c-12: ^"The Gilded Summons was supposed to give us the much needed reinforcements. The Magisters offer a profitable contract to those not enlisted already. But the call is being answered hesitantly and I fear we might be losing ground soon."
c-13: ^"The Demons seem nearly endless. We anticipated resistance, even after Rae's initial strike - but I've never seen their ranks grow so large in so little time."
c-14: ^"The Crusade IS the plan. Rae gave us a sign, casting their beacon onto these dark lands. It turned to a rallying cry, a banner the entire Shattered Realms could stand behind. But that's not all."
^"As the prophecy foretold, she sent us a Champion. An avatar of light carving the path into the abyss of Umbris and reclaim what was lost so long ago."

c-15: ^"Of course we are. But so far, all our scouts have- well, disappeared as well."
c-16: ^"Despite my advice against such a bold move, the Dawnbringer and a small number of his followers set out to the Black Citadel itself. I hesitate to ask this of you [[class]], but the time for indecision is over."
c-17: ^"To put it bluntly, there will not be much of a war if we don't find our Champion soon. You have proven capable up to this point, perhaps you will succeed where the Militia has not."

mission: ^Do you think they are still alive?
^What do I do once I find them?

c-18: ^"We don't. But, an avatar of light and long foretold Champion doesn't just... vanish and die. He must be up to something - we just need to know what it is before this whole war effort falls apart."
c-19: ^"Report back, or aid them in whatever way you can. We need to break the Black Citadel or all hope is lost."
c-20: ^"I don't know why, but I believe you just might. May the light guide your path, [[class]]. You will have earned more than just the Regent's favor should you succeed in this mission."

skip: ^"You've more than proven yourself, so I'll be brief. We need to find the Dawnbringer before all hope is lost. Do this, and save Brightcandle so we can fight another day."
leavewithsoldiers: ^"As for the traitors you've brought back... I am not sure they deserve a second chance, but we can ill afford to turn down what little advantages we are offered. Take this extra with my thanks, [[class]] - if anything this is the first good sign we've seen in quite some time."
